result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Scott Greenwald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Scott Greenwald is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Scott Greenwald was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

records.addlTxt:
8:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 with a fine, costs, DNA and restiution.  Statement by DA Christenson, yesterday an amended restitution was filed with a $35 addition for NSF check.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2.  Court orders counts 1, 3 & 4 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Restitution - $3,852.34.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 8:44 a.m.
Summary of Restitution - $3,852.34

Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Roeth and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Roeth enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 4, 2017 at 10:30 a.m.

1:10 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the warrant.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  Statement by defendant - address is:  101 E. Main St  Stratford, WI  54484.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Swanke Dairy Farm.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.
